Key Match Events: Edwin Uceta was ejected from the game after intentionally hitting Nick Castellanos with a pitch, leading to a benches-clearing incident.
Trea Turner hit a two-run home run, and Bryce Harper doubled in the next at-bat.
Buddy Kennedy hit an RBI single, and Cal Stevenson doubled to give the Phillies a 6-4 lead.
Nick Castellanos hit a two-run home run in the first inning after being hit by a pitch the night before.
Post-Match Reflections: The incident with Edwin Uceta and Nick Castellanos could be a spark for the Phillies as they head into the final push of the regular season and the postseason.
The Phillies believe they have the right talent and clubhouse to do something special in 2024.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies won the next game Wednesday night to sweep the Rays out of Philadelphia.
The Phillies hold an 8.0-game lead over the New York Mets in the NL East and own the best record in baseball.
Others: Mike Hennelly is a 2024 graduate of The Pennsylvania State University with a Bachelor of Arts degree in digital and print journalism and a minor in sports studies.
